alert.note: Alert for Northwest Raleigh (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued February 03 at 2:38AM EST until February 04 at 10:00AM EST by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM 7 AM EST THIS MORNING THROUGH LATE TONIGHT... The National Weather Service in Charleston has expanded the * Flood Watch to include portions of southeast Ohio and West Virginia, including the following areas, in southeast Ohio, Athens, Gallia, Lawrence OH, Meigs, and Washington. In West Virginia, Barbour, Braxton, Calhoun, Clay, Doddridge, Gilmer, Harrison, Lewis, Northwest Fayette, Northwest Nicholas, Northwest Pocahontas, Northwest Raleigh, Northwest Randolph, Northwest Webster, Southeast Fayette, Southeast Nicholas, Southeast Pocahontas, Southeast Raleigh, Southeast Randolph, Southeast Webster, Taylor, and Upshur. * From 7 AM EST this morning through late tonight * WHEN...From 7 AM EST Thursday through late Thursday night. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, larger creeks, and other low-lying and flood- prone locations. Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. Low-water crossings may be flooded.
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
